newsitem.title: TURKMENISTAN: Turkmens aim new energy law at foreign investors.
newsitem.headline: Turkmens aim new energy law at foreign investors.

text.p: Turkmenistan has streamlined its licensing system for companies wishing to develop the former Soviet republic's oil and gas riches with a new law designed to attract foreign investment, an energy official said on Tuesday.

"The new law will allow us to get rid of procedures which delayed agreements and which scared off many foreign investors in the past," Gochmurad Nazdzhanov, Turkmenistan's minister for oil, gas and mineral resources, told reporters in the capital Ashgabat.

The new law states that licences for hydrocarbons will be issued by the desert nation's cabinet of ministers, either in the form of a competitive tender or through direct negotiations, Nazdzhanov said.

Licences to prospect for hydrocarbons will be issued for up to six years, with an option to renew for a further four years. Production licences will be issued for up to 20 years, with the possibility to extend the licence by a further five years.
